title: Privilege Escalation From user to SYSTEM via unauthenticated command execution
vulnerability_information:
The vulnerability, or feature depending how you look at it, is the ability to execute commands using the 
evostream API interface that is exposed on localhost:7440. Since the evostream service is running as SYSTEM a user can use the launchprocess command,  http://docs.evostream.com/2.0/launchProcess.html, to execute any binary with supplied arguments. The only thing that is keeping this "feature" from allowing remote code execution is the fact that it listens on localhost only. However, if it were couple with an SSRF, an attacker could achieve full remote code execution.

## Impact

The ability to run arbitrary commands as SYSTEM from any user.
vulnerability_information_html:
The vulnerability, or feature depending how you look at it, is the ability to execute commands using the
evostream API interface that is exposed on localhost:7440. Since the evostream service is running as SYSTEM a user can use the launchprocess command, http://docs.evostream.com/2.0/launchProcess.html, to execute any binary with supplied arguments. The only thing that is keeping this "feature" from allowing remote code execution is the fact that it listens on localhost only. However, if it were couple with an SSRF, an attacker could achieve full remote code execution.

Impact

The ability to run arbitrary commands as SYSTEM from any user.

activities.message: UniFi Video Server, the POC also requires the websocket-client python library. I realize rereading the description it may have been confusing that this report is for the UniFi Video Server. The evostream software described in the original disclosure is installed and used by the UniFi Video Server software.

activities.message:
UPDATE:  Per my original suspicion, I was able to achieve full RCE by hosting a javascript payload remotely that sends websocket requests to the evostream webserver on localhost. I've attached the javascript POC and a video showing the execution of calc.exe from a webpage. I'll leave it up at https://www.securifera.com/rce0923234.html if you'd like to test it out. As this bug is getting close to being closed out, could you please update the severity score to 9.6 (https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln-metrics/cvss/v3-calculator?vector=AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:R/S:C/C:H/I:H/A:H) to reflect its true severity.

FYI, once you have a patch ready to be tested for it, let me know and I'm more than willing to confirm the fix.

activities.message: I tested the attached beta and it appears client certificate authentication has been added which secures it against the current POC. At this point an attacker would have to at least get access to the client certificate to connect to the service. If you would like me to investigate further I can but that could require more effort to track down the certificate and see if it's possible for an attacker to use it to get to the next step of verification.

activities.message:
Ok, so originally the bug was categorized and rated as a local privilege escalation vulnerability from user to SYSTEM privileges with the following CVSS score using Hackerone's in report calculator.


Using Hackerone's CVSS v3.0 Calculator - __7.8__

	Attack Vector - Local
	Attack Complexity - Low
	Privileges Required - Low
	User Interaction - None

	Scope - Unchanged
	Confidentiality - High
	Confidentiality - High
	Confidentiality - High

With the confirmation and proof of remote exploitation, attachment F535512, F535513, the vulnerability is now categorized as a remote code execution vulnerability. This changes a few components of the CVSS score. The attack vector can now be exploited over the network, no privileges are required, the scope is changed, and user interaction is required. Per Hackerone's CVSS calculator, that changes the score to a 9.6 as shown below.

Using Hackerone's CVSS v3.0 Calculator - __9.6__

	Attack Vector - Network
	Attack Complexity - Low
	Privileges Required - None
	User Interaction - Required

	Scope - Changed
	Confidentiality - High
	Confidentiality - High
	Confidentiality - High
	
	
If you agree with this then I would think it would appropriate to adjust the score. Thoughts?
activities.markdown_message:
Ok, so originally the bug was categorized and rated as a local privilege escalation vulnerability from user to SYSTEM privileges with the following CVSS score using Hackerone's in report calculator.

Using Hackerone's CVSS v3.0 Calculator - 7.8

With the confirmation and proof of remote exploitation, attachment ubiq_rce.mp4 (F535512), rce0923234.html (F535513), the vulnerability is now categorized as a remote code execution vulnerability. This changes a few components of the CVSS score. The attack vector can now be exploited over the network, no privileges are required, the scope is changed, and user interaction is required. Per Hackerone's CVSS calculator, that changes the score to a 9.6 as shown below.

Using Hackerone's CVSS v3.0 Calculator - 9.6

Attack Vector - Network
Attack Complexity - Low
Privileges Required - None
User Interaction - Required

Scope - Changed
Confidentiality - High
Confidentiality - High
Confidentiality - High

If you agree with this then I would think it would appropriate to adjust the score. Thoughts?

activities.message:
Hi @b0yd - Sorry the late response, we reviewed internally the proposed score and agreed with the change in the CVSS elements such as attack vector: network, no privileges are required and user interaction is required, however we think that "Scope" is Unchanged as vulnerability may allow authorization bypass, but impact is contained to the original scope of vulnerable component. Using Hackerone's CVSS v3.0 Calculator - 8.8.  Please let us know if you agree, so we can proceed with the reward. 
We have also requested the CVE, that should be available soon.
activities.markdown_message:
Hi @b0yd - Sorry the late response, we reviewed internally the proposed score and agreed with the change in the CVSS elements such as attack vector: network, no privileges are required and user interaction is required, however we think that "Scope" is Unchanged as vulnerability may allow authorization bypass, but impact is contained to the original scope of vulnerable component. Using Hackerone's CVSS v3.0 Calculator - 8.8. Please let us know if you agree, so we can proceed with the reward.
We have also requested the CVE, that should be available soon.

activities.message: I am curious how the scope would be considered Unchanged as the component is running as SYSTEM, thus giving an attacker full access to anything on the computer. My understanding of "unchanged" scope is that an exploit of the vulnerability would not affect confidentiality, integrity, or availability of anything outside of the component. However exploitation of this vulnerability, provides SYSTEM privileges, and thus allows for an attacker to affect these measures for any other software on the system and possibly the network if it is domain joined.
activities.markdown_message: I am curious how the scope would be considered Unchanged as the component is running as SYSTEM, thus giving an attacker full access to anything on the computer. activities.message: Hi @b0yd  - After further discussion with our team we agree with the score proposed and the cvss item "scope", with that in mind we are changing the score to 9.6 and bounty will be correspondent to this score. Thank you for your time and help in this topic.
